title: Game UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
As a UX Designer, you will be responsible for the design of casual multiplayer games on platforms like iOS, android, Web.

  • Construct engaging and creative gameplay systems with fun features that will improve user experience, engagement, and monetization.
  • Transform high- level ideas into detailed and well- thought out concepts.
  • Analyze key performance indicators, user testing and feedback, recommend design solutions, and modify game concepts accordingly.
  • Remain current on industry trends including: new game genres, new mechanics, and new game design methods.
  • Conceptualize games from scratch and co-ordinate with studio teams to build out mockups, wireframes, features, animations and deliver the game on budget and on schedule
  • Manage a pipeline of games, engage with new studios, negotiate contracts and collaborate with teams to deliver on game requirements
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.

We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• Has a long- standing passion for playing games of multiple genres and platforms and a solid background in video games and free- to- play games.
  • Understanding of viral design, retention, and monetization techniques for games with a virtual goods economy and business model.
  • Solid understanding of popular mobile, casual, and social games - recognizes what makes them fun.
  • 5+ years of Game Design experience with products shipped; at least 2 years with mobile, social, or tablet.
  • Strong knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash etc...
  • Experience in graphic design, typography, sketching, wireframes & flows.
  • Degree in Engineering or coding experience is preferred

title: Game Visual Designer
primaryresponsibility:
As a Game Artist you will create and own the core UI/UX or a diverse set of games. You must possess excellent communication (both written & verbal) and time management skills to ensure efficient execution with various departments i.e. Tech, Design, QA, Marketing. Your responsibilities will involve:

  • End to end UI/UX & creative direction of a game including concepts, backgrounds, characters, layouts, typography, animations
  • Own the complete game art - concept, production and beyond
  • Be proficient in use of the Adobe CS. Knowledge of 3DS Max/Maya is a huge plus
  • Work independently in a fast paced environment to rapidly prototype game concepts and designs
  • Assist in creating editorial content, marketing materials, descriptions, and promotional content
  • Visualizing a theme and adapting game elements and assets on the same
  • Remain up to date on industry trends and best practices
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.

We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• Bachelor's Degree in any art discipline. Game design/art degree or diploma is a big plus
  • 2-6 years of gaming industry experience creating game art for high quality social/casino mobile games
  • Expert level skills in game UI designing with Adobe CS - Flash/Photoshop/Illustrator
  • Proficient in creating Flash animations and graphics
  • Expert in drawing and in creating endearing game characters and backgrounds with a superlative portfolio of international style art work
  • Should possess good knowledge of perspectives.
  • Prior hands-on experience in art creation for social games is a huge plus.
  • Must have worked on at least one top notch production game title from concept to ship with 1M+ downloads
  • Passion for games and High product ownership - Ability to work independently, cleverly, and meet deadlines under pressure.
  • Strong and effective communication (written and oral).
  • Experience in and strong understanding of Free-to-Play model with deep expertise in creative exciting new art styles.
  • Must demonstrate strong passion towards mobile games and strong aesthetics to design world class games

title: Senior Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for a graphic designer with a strong inclination towards branding, social media and digital designs to create Icons, Social Media marketing campaigns and web designs / info-graphics. You will be expected to come up with creative ways of turning our digital marketing strategy into digital media assets.

  • Design stunning marketing collaterals such as digital and mobile banners, print collaterals such as brochures, leaflets, posters
  • Design imagery for email, social media campaigns and contests
  • Understanding the requirements and coming up with design options
  • Develops site content and graphics by coordinating with copywriters and graphic artists; designing images, icons, banners, audio enhancements, etc.
  • Conceptualizing and executing content marketing initiatives
  • Contribute to the overall marketing process
primaryrequirement:
The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior graphic designing skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into outstanding visuals. ​

  • 2 to 5 years of experience as a graphic / communication designer
  • Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio
  • Creative flair, originality and a strong visual sense
  • Experience / knowledge working with Adobe creative suit (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
  • Knowledge in Video/Audio editing tools will be a plus
  • A matter-of-fact approach when ideas or designs are rejected
  • Understanding of or experience in UX/UI design/web design will be an added advantage
  • Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction​
  • Basic understanding of advertising and/or digital marketing
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • An eye for photography
  • Arts / Design graduates preferred

title: Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility:
You will be expected to come up with creative ways of turning our digital marketing strategy into digital and print media assets

  • Create engaging concepts and visually appealing designs for the highest level of connect with the target groups across all channels (Digital, Print, Social Media, Web)
  • Design imagery for email, social media campaigns and contests
  • Design offline marketing collateral such as brochures, billboards and visiting cards
  • Translate written ad briefs or wireframes into finished ads
  • Develop the design rationale and explain visual choices to cross-functional teams
  • Create assets that reflect a brand and enforce the common design language of Edureka
  • Brainstorm in creative meetings to understand requirements and advise with creative ideas
primaryrequirement:
• 1 to 4 years of hands-on experience in crafting marketing ideas in beautiful visuals
  • Extensive Hands-on experience in Branding and Marketing designs
  • Show creativity to bring in smart ideas and deliver the punch required in good marketing communication
  • Keen eye for photography and visual designing

title: Design Lead, Marketing
primaryresponsibility:
As a Design Lead, you will spearhead the team responsible for delivering clutter-breaking online and offline campaigns with the marketing team. Working closely with the creative head and the rest of the marketing team, you will bring our creative communication and marketing campaigns alive and will be supporting various other teams in their design requirements. You will be working with a team of passionate designers to lead the entire cycle from creative concept to messaging to campaign creation and execution. On a day to day basis, you will be working on

  • New design concepts to support marketing
  • Inspiring creativity among the designers
  • Pushing the design team to achieve high quality output
  • Ensuring timely delivery of all social media and digital campaign designs
  • Ensuring clutter-breaking creatives for strategic marketing campaigns
  • Leading regular tactical campaigns with the designers
  • Allocation of work among the designers and time management
  • Delivering out-of-the-box designs, in line with Treebo’s brand language
  • Ensuring consistency in all design elements across media
  • Being the guardian of Treebo’s visual brand language across all consumer touch-points
primaryperks:
Talented and motivated co-workers in a fun office environment
Flexible Work options
Never have a boring Day!
Competitive Salary
Create clutter-breaking designs for a much loved brand
30 room nights of Treebo credits every year
Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
primaryrequirement:
• At least 4 years of experience in creative campaigns
  • Experience in creating and managing brand language and identity
  • Experience in managing a team of designers and artists
  • Strong design knowledge and experience with offline and online media
  • Strong communication and team management skills
  • Good knowledge of project management and multi-tasking
  • Expertise in Adobe Suite and other design software
  • Keen eye for good quality visual designing
  • High commitment levels to be a part of a fast-paced industry-defining startup
  • Education in communication / visual design is an added advantage

title: Creative Director
primaryresponsibility: As Creative Director at OYO, you will be responsible for the portrayal of OYO’s visual identity in coherence with business requirements and the brand identity, across digital and physical platforms. The Creative Director is also expected to oversee the visual graphics team comprising junior graphic designers. Whether it is getting the brand tone right or developing expansive/innovative campaigns or designing classy brochures, the creative design team is dedicated to making sure everything that OYO publishes, looks and feels amazing.
primaryrequirement:
You will be able to make this role your own if you possess:

  • 8+ years of relevant experience, with a minimum of 3 years managing a team of graphics/visual designers and leading visual design development for a consumer oriented design environment
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Corel Draw and any other design tools necessary
  • Experience in developing designs for both online and offline channels
  • Comfort working in a chaotic, fast paced, dynamic environment with lack of predictability
  • The experience and/or understanding of how to create a visual identity from scratch
  • Great understanding of consumers and how to build a strong connect with them
  • Experience working with cross-functional business teams; strong grasp of understanding business requirements and translating to visual identity
  • Experience in project/team management

title: Visual Designer, Marketing
primaryresponsibility: OYO is looking for designers to help support its experienced graphic design team for creating simple, engaging and extremely intuitive graphic designs. Whether it is innovative campaigns (marketing and others) or quirky social media posts or classy brochures, our graphic design team is dedicated to making sure everything that OYO launches looks and feels amazing.
primaryrequirement:
YOU have…

  • The imagination to sketch an idea, a concept, or a character
  • An eye for detail, vivid colors and pixel-perfection
  • A burning desire to work for an innovative startup and contribute to change
  • OYO is looking for YOU. YOU - The Illustrator YOU - The Digital Marketeer YOU - The Communicator YOU - The Hustler
  • You have at least 2 years of experience with creative campaigns
  • Keen eye for good quality visual designing
  • Hands-on experience in creating various design elements across online and offline media
  • High commitment levels to be a part of a fast-paced industry-defining startup
  • Education in communication / visual design is an added advantage

title: Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for a Design Professional who can play a pivotal role in driving the product marketing initiatives across Digital and offline channels in a new generation startup. You will be working closely with the marketing team to create campaign visuals and build a strong understanding of our user base. On a day to day basis, you will be working on:

  • Social Media and Digital Campaigns
  • Creatives for Strategic Marketing Campaigns
  • Tactical Campaigns – Topical, Festivals, Events
  • Outdoor and Print – Banners, Posters, Other Collaterals
  • Communication Design – Emailers & Partner Communication
  • Visual Design and Brand Language
primaryrequirement:
• 1 to 3 years of relevant experience in graphic design
  • Experience in working with technology product start-ups in the internet and mobile space
  • Ability to conceptualize and develop interesting communication messages and ads for the online customers
  • Ability to conceptualize and design products and communication message with a desire to build the best ever product/marketing message in the market
  • Highly passionate and enthusiastic about technology product design in the internet and mobile space. Eat, Sleeps, Drinks and Lives Design
  • Highly motivated to work in a startup with little support but with a vision to build the next multimillion dollar company

title: Sr. Communications Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Our Mumbai and Kolkata offices are looking for senior designers with a love for communication and publication design.

  • Comprehend, simplify and translate complex content into visuals
  • Refine and detail typographic sensibility. Illustration skills are a plus
  • Exceptional conceptual and strategic thinking
  • Understand the basics of communication design across different platforms
  • Basic knowledge of web and films will have an added advantage
  • Basic knowledge of digital be an added advantage
primaryrequirement:
A proven track record of exceptional creativity, experience of working on diverse industries and projects, proficiency in design software and an ability to work seamlessly as part of a team are attributes that we value.

  • Be creative, ambitious and highly motivated
  • Belong to a prestigious design school
  • Confer with project managers and clients to understand the design requirement for projects
  • Is very passionate about typography
  • Have excellent communication skills—verbal and written
  • Be proficient with design software like Adobe InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Have a willingness to learn and adapt to newer trends and software
  • Have production knowledge (artworks and printing)
  • Client fronting and management skills for the Sr. Role

title: Sr. Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility: As a Sr. Graphic Designer, this role requires the person to push the boundaries of imagination for all our clients. You will be mentoring a team of graphic designers across multiple projects. You will be responsible for delivering clutter-breaking digital campaigns. Working closely with the creative head, you will bring our creative communication and marketing campaigns alive and reporting to the SVP – Content and Creative.
primaryrequirement:
• At least 3+ years of experience with communication design
  • Formal design schooling at a reputed institute
  • Understanding of various art forms is very critical. You should possess great illustration and graphic designing skills
  • Be pro-active and able to show initiative/ideas to constantly engage with target users
  • Must have experience working with Social Media, Google Ads, Emailers and Print Designs
  • Must have in-depth experience in creating designs that appeals to a digitally native audience across social platforms, Google, websites, email communication and other digital mediums

title: 3D Visualizer
primaryresponsibility:
We like to see before we believe. You will help us look into the future, see our interior spaces come alive in 3D before we create the space for real.
You will be a damn good 3D artist who will help bring our imagination into visual media. You will create looks for our website and you will also help in modeling furniture that we develop before we start our prototyping process.
Staying organized and creating a library of models and other props will be vital to help scale our 3D design team, and you will be the gate keeper.
primaryrequirement:
• Minimum 2 years of experience in the 3D Visualization
  • Keen eye for good quality visual imagery
  • Ability to create high quality output in 3DS Max with Vray
  • Understanding of interior lighting in Vray

title: Interior Designer
primaryresponsibility:
The Design Room is looking for interior designers with a passion to create unique experiences for clients in their residential spaces. As an interior designer at The Design Room, designers need to understand the client brief, create designs based on customer preferences and site conditions and prepare dockets to handover to our execution teams.
Designers will be working with the design lead to deliver the highest quality design output, the project managers to execute projects seamlessly on site and the partners and suppliers to source the best products for the given space.
We are looking for go-getters who can handle a design project from start to finish and deliver the same to our clients with utmost customer satisfaction.
primaryrequirement:
• Minimum 2 years of experience in residential interior design
  • Strong understanding and demonstrated aptitude of design principles
  • No-compromise attitude towards quality
  • Highly proficiency in AutoCAD, Photoshop, Sketchup
  • Strong communication skills

title: Sr. iOS Developer
primaryresponsibility: NULL
primaryrequirement:
Business Knowledge: Domain experience would be a plus Personal Attributes: Strong and innovative approach to problem solving and finding solutions b. Excellent communicator (written and verbal, formal and informal) c. Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution d. Ability to multi-task under pressure and work independently with minimal supervision

  • Have worked at least 2 live project using Swift
  • App lifecycle & delegates, UI View Controller lifecycle. App foreground & background handling
  • Thorough understanding & hands on experience on most commonly used design concepts such as MVC, Singleton, Dependency Injection, KVO, Notification, Adaptor
  • From the UI standpoint should be well aware of the Autolayout, size classes, Constraints, UIKit most commonly used UI components & customization such as UI TableViewCell, UI Collection View
  • Custom Animations is good to have

  • Swift coding best practices & guidelines
  • Exception handling
  • Understanding of network request & response handling using foundation classes such as NSURLSession, differences between different types of http methods GET, POST. JSON parsing & URL caching
  • App profiling which includes identifying memory leaks, best practices of memory management
  • Data Storage different approaches & the difference such as persistence, keychain, object serialization
  • Using coredata & cache management for local data management is good to have
  • Browse candidate on Logical reasoning & approach by giving a real time situation
  • Unit Test cases are good to have

title: Creative Manager
primaryresponsibility: The Senior Creative Manager/Senior Product Manager will be responsible for managing, developing and driving BYJU’S Media Team activity, particularly in the area of project and people management. The key responsibilities include managing daily operative on the media floor, determining and monitoring production schedule, delegating and directing production teams, overseeing preproduction, production, and post-production of projects, propagating product research and product innovation and developing creative briefs and design concepts to meet business objectives. Additional responsibilities include and are not limited to mentoring, reviewing and appraising teams and team leads and creating a vision for the product.
primaryrequirement:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (Engineering/design/animation/film-making or related)
  • At least 6 years of experience and at least 2 years in a team leading role
  • Should be familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures
  • Should rely on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
  • Should be able to perform a variety of tasks along with leading and directing the work of others
  • A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected

title: Sr. Creative Associate
primaryresponsibility:
The Creative Associate is a part of the Media Team at Byjus. The Media team works with multiple categories and course teams to visualize, produce, and edit content to make it much more meaningful, explanatory and visually appealing.

We are looking to hire an exceptionally passionate and fun-loving bunch of creative directors, creative managers, Motion graphic designer, editors, VFX artists, Digital artists, 2D and 3D animators, Compositor, Lighting and Texturing Artist, Linear Editor, Character Designer, Typography Artist, Post Production Specialist, Storyboarding Artist, or a combination of many of these skills. You should be able to grasp basic sciences quickly and competence to translate it into visually appealing formats. Naturally, a flair for storytelling and constant exercise of those creative grey cells on a regular basis is a necessary prerequisite. Work experience in the media industry and proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite is expected.

You will be responsible for executing assigned media projects in association with a team and under the supervision of a senior creative manager/ senior product manager. The key responsibilities include managing daily team operative, determining and monitoring project schedule, delegating and directing the team activities, overseeing pre-production, production, and post-production of the assigned project, propagating product research and product innovation and developing creative briefs and design concepts to meet business objectives. Additional responsibilities include and are not restricted to mentoring team members and creating a vision for the product.

The Senior Associate is expected to bring a higher level of expertise and experience on board. Along with Task Execution, there will be need for handling individual projects, cross-team coordination, asset building. From a more mature standpoint, the Senior Associate is expected to indulge in pipeline process monitoring and mentoring.

 

Roles that we offer

Editor
As an editor, you are responsible for our ‘wow’ videos reaching the students across the globe. You will be a crucial aspect of many products that involve videos. The artist must be acquainted with simple solutions to keying and color correction.

Skill: A Beginner to Expert level skill with Adobe Suite and allied tools for (Non-Linear) Video Editing, Filmmaking & Media, Color Correction, Basics of Compositing, Frame Design, Creative Thinking (Adobe Premiere Pro (including Keying and Lumetri), Sound Forge, Vegas, Final Cut Pro)

 

2D Animator
2d animators are expected to be specialists and/or experts in classical animation, character animation, motion graphics, dynamic typography and others such. This requires a strong grasp of tools and fluent use of tools. Well acquainted with the Principles of Design, the animator is who brings life to the different things on screen.

Skill: Prior experience in or interest in classical animation, digital animation, typography and kinetic typography, use of effects and transitions, layout design, frame composition, communication design, Object-Oriented Programming. Candidate must be able to translate multimedia tool-based visual enhancements to concepts in Math, Science and Language. Plugins such as Duik and Pivot, Adobe Suite (Both AfterEffects and Flash) and Hand-Drawing. Working knowledge of 3rd party plugins in After Effects or the skill to learn them quick is necessary - Red Giant Trapcode Suite, Element 3D, Plexus, Motion V2, Newton (Adobe After Effects (including Duik, Forward-Inverse Kinematics, Puppet Pins 3rdparty plugins – Red Giant Trapcode Suite, VideoCopilot Suite including Element 3d and others, Plexus, Newton and other Physics Simulators, Motion V2, etc.), Character Animator, Flash and Photoshop Timeline Animation, etc.

 

VFX Artist
Visual effects artists are responsible for creating computer-generated frames and special effects. Common effects like grunge, smoke, fire, rain, smog, particles, etc. must be an easy fix for a VFX Artist. 2- and 3-d motion and camera tracking is a useful skill. The artist must be acquainted with simple solutions to keying and color correction.

Skill: Prior experience in or interest in tools for compositing, animation, Rotoscopy, motion tracking, camera tracking, matte, rendering, motion graphics, building simulations through application of computation and math in animating and allied fields. Candidate must be able to translate multimedia tool-based visual enhancements to concepts in Math, Science and Language. Creative skill would include being able to augment real footage with appropriate highlights and tracking and other effects (Mocha, Red Giant Trapcode Suite, Plexus, Color Correction and Grading Tools)

 

3D Artist
An enthusiast or an expert in making and simulating exciting 3-d Graphics.

Skill: Prior experience in or interest in tools for (some or all of) modelling, texturing, lighting, rigging, unwrapping, painting, creating environments, building objects and relationships and building simulations through application of computation and math in 3-d animating and allied fields. Candidate must be able to work-cross platform and integrate 3-d with different rendering and animation tools (Maya, C4D, 3DS Max, Unity)

 

Artist
If your chosen mode of expression has anything to do with design, painting, creative visualization, cartooning, conceptualizing, then your crazy skills will come in handy to be a part of a super-talented young artists. You will be making print and graphic art that is used across the company from the flyers to the videos to the app to the global outreach programs.

Skill: Strength with the Adobe Suite, and allied digital design tools is a must. Flexibility with Art Styles and the ability to gather requirements from different animators and in-house-clients is a necessary skill (Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash, In-Design. CorelDraw, Google Sketch, SketchBook Pro, etc.)

 

SFX Artist
We are looking for Sound Engineers, SFX Artist and Sound Designers – a bunch of creators who have an aptitude for science and art; scientific thinking and design thinking. A workplace thriving on young energy, on mentorship, craziness, drive and commitment to making a difference, this is what we could open for you.

Skill: Should have experience in composing musical score suitable for K12, jingles and rhymes for kids in different genres, Game sounds/SFX/Sound Design. Should have experience in recording voice over, field recording and recording musical instruments. Know music theory and play at least one instrument. Be familiar and experienced in composing music in any genres. Complete knowledge of Logic including SMPTE/video sync, freezing, organizing, and STEMS. It is an add-on if you have worked on short films. (Knowledge about different file formats and work flow)
primaryperks:
Growth Opportunity
Organic growth within the organization is assured at much-better-than-industry-standards considering the nature of projects we undertake and the rate of global expansion. Growth, as is validated by the work done by the employee, can be in Leadership, Management, Specialist, Expert Roles. The Industry - Tech. and Media for Education, is very nascent and is bound to scale up.
primaryrequirement:
• Bachelor's degree (Design/ Animation/ Film-making/ Media management/ Engineering)

title: Sr. Creative Associate
primaryresponsibility:
The Creative Associate is a part of the Media Team at Byjus. The Media team works with multiple categories and course teams to visualize, produce, and edit content to make it much more meaningful, explanatory and visually appealing.

We are looking to hire an exceptionally passionate and fun-loving bunch of creative directors, creative managers, Motion graphic designer, editors, VFX artists, Digital artists, 2D and 3D animators, Compositor, Lighting and Texturing Artist, Linear Editor, Character Designer, Typography Artist, Post Production Specialist, Storyboarding Artist, or a combination of many of these skills. You should be able to grasp basic sciences quickly and competence to translate it into visually appealing formats. Naturally, a flair for storytelling and constant exercise of those creative grey cells on a regular basis is a necessary prerequisite. Work experience in the media industry and proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite is expected.

You will be responsible for executing assigned media projects in association with a team and under the supervision of a senior creative manager/ senior product manager. The key responsibilities include managing daily team operative, determining and monitoring project schedule, delegating and directing the team activities, overseeing pre-production, production, and post-production of the assigned project, propagating product research and product innovation and developing creative briefs and design concepts to meet business objectives. Additional responsibilities include and are not restricted to mentoring team members and creating a vision for the product.

The Senior Associate is expected to bring a higher level of expertise and experience on board. Along with Task Execution, there will be need for handling individual projects, cross-team coordination, asset building. From a more mature standpoint, the Senior Associate is expected to indulge in pipeline process monitoring and mentoring.

 

Roles that we offer

Editor
As an editor, you are responsible for our ‘wow’ videos reaching the students across the globe. You will be a crucial aspect of many products that involve videos. The artist must be acquainted with simple solutions to keying and color correction.

Skill: A Beginner to Expert level skill with Adobe Suite and allied tools for (Non-Linear) Video Editing, Filmmaking & Media, Color Correction, Basics of Compositing, Frame Design, Creative Thinking (Adobe Premiere Pro (including Keying and Lumetri), Sound Forge, Vegas, Final Cut Pro)

2D Animator
2d animators are expected to be specialists and/or experts in classical animation, character animation, motion graphics, dynamic typography and others such. This requires a strong grasp of tools and fluent use of tools. Well acquainted with the Principles of Design, the animator is who brings life to the different things on screen.

Skill: Prior experience in or interest in classical animation, digital animation, typography and kinetic typography, use of effects and transitions, layout design, frame composition, communication design, Object-Oriented Programming. Candidate must be able to translate multimedia tool-based visual enhancements to concepts in Math, Science and Language. Plugins such as Duik and Pivot, Adobe Suite (Both AfterEffects and Flash) and Hand-Drawing. Working knowledge of 3rd party plugins in After Effects or the skill to learn them quick is necessary - Red Giant Trapcode Suite, Element 3D, Plexus, Motion V2, Newton (Adobe After Effects (including Duik, Forward-Inverse Kinematics, Puppet Pins 3rdparty plugins – Red Giant Trapcode Suite, VideoCopilot Suite including Element 3d and others, Plexus, Newton and other Physics Simulators, Motion V2, etc.), Character Animator, Flash and Photoshop Timeline Animation, etc.

VFX Artist
Visual effects artists are responsible for creating computer-generated frames and special effects. Common effects like grunge, smoke, fire, rain, smog, particles, etc. must be an easy fix for a VFX Artist. 2- and 3-d motion and camera tracking is a useful skill. The artist must be acquainted with simple solutions to keying and color correction.

Skill: Prior experience in or interest in tools for compositing, animation, Rotoscopy, motion tracking, camera tracking, matte, rendering, motion graphics, building simulations through application of computation and math in animating and allied fields. Candidate must be able to translate multimedia tool-based visual enhancements to concepts in Math, Science and Language. Creative skill would include being able to augment real footage with appropriate highlights and tracking and other effects (Mocha, Red Giant Trapcode Suite, Plexus, Color Correction and Grading Tools)

3D Artist
An enthusiast or an expert in making and simulating exciting 3-d Graphics.

Skill: Prior experience in or interest in tools for (some or all of) modelling, texturing, lighting, rigging, unwrapping, painting, creating environments, building objects and relationships and building simulations through application of computation and math in 3-d animating and allied fields. Candidate must be able to work-cross platform and integrate 3-d with different rendering and animation tools (Maya, C4D, 3DS Max, Unity)

Artist
If your chosen mode of expression has anything to do with design, painting, creative visualization, cartooning, conceptualizing, then your crazy skills will come in handy to be a part of a super-talented young artists. You will be making print and graphic art that is used across the company from the flyers to the videos to the app to the global outreach programs.

Skill: Strength with the Adobe Suite, and allied digital design tools is a must. Flexibility with Art Styles and the ability to gather requirements from different animators and in-house-clients is a necessary skill (Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash, In-Design. CorelDraw, Google Sketch, SketchBook Pro, etc.)

SFX Artist
We are looking for Sound Engineers, SFX Artist and Sound Designers – a bunch of creators who have an aptitude for science and art; scientific thinking and design thinking. A workplace thriving on young energy, on mentorship, craziness, drive and commitment to making a difference, this is what we could open for you.

Skill: Should have experience in composing musical score suitable for K12, jingles and rhymes for kids in different genres, Game sounds/SFX/Sound Design. Should have experience in recording voice over, field recording and recording musical instruments. Know music theory and play at least one instrument. Be familiar and experienced in composing music in any genres. Complete knowledge of Logic including SMPTE/video sync, freezing, organizing, and STEMS. It is an add-on if you have worked on short films. (Knowledge about different file formats and work flow)
primaryperks:
Growth Opportunity
Organic growth within the organization is assured at much-better-than-industry-standards considering the nature of projects we undertake and the rate of global expansion. Growth, as is validated by the work done by the employee, can be in Leadership, Management, Specialist, Expert Roles. The Industry - Tech. and Media for Education, is very nascent and is bound to scale up.

The ideal candidate has both soft goods and hard goods design experience. Your ability to work in a close knit group environment and to form working partnerships is crucial.

  • Design the consumer products for our brands in collaboration with the product team

  • Design with an understanding of product specs, surface design, and material specs as needed

  • Evaluate and maintain products throughout the lifecycle adjusting
  • Research of relative categories as required being product category expert

title: Lead / Senior Visual Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Flock is looking to hire a Visual Designer to work on a range of mobile platforms (Android, iOS and Windows Phone). Mobile design experience is required. As a Visual Designer, you will work with motivated individuals (who are passionate-beyond-measure about usability) to deliver a kick-ass user experience for our suite of communication products. You will be playing a pivotal role in the UX cycle: research and create visually pleasing interfaces, coordinating their implementation and integration, and more. You will be expected to apply user-centered design processes to create high quality user experiences, and reusable patterns and assets for various products.

  • Designing visually stunning user interfaces
  • Translating wireframes into visual design
  • Creating user interface elements and assets
  • Evaluating multiple concepts for projects and suggesting ideas are worth pursuing
  • Fulfilling several requests simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the
industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered
meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables,
and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work
hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own
concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.
We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy
Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace
on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work),
then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• Solid background and knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and/or Adobe Fireworks
  • Demonstrated success in delivering visually pleasing designs
  • Strong knowledge of color theory
  • Good communication skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Formal education in design (Bachelor's/Master's/Diploma)
  • Experience in designing/deploying mobile apps on either: Android, BlackBerry or iOS (include app listings if published)
  • Experience in wire-framing/prototyping using any of the following: Balsamiq, Fireworks, OmniGraffle, Keynotopia or Axure
  • Understanding of Usability
  • Should love Dilbert

title: Lead Product Designer
primaryresponsibility:
As the Lead Product designer and Researcher, you will work with a team of talented and highly collaborative designers, product managers and engineers to develop a wide range of products across multiple user interfacing channels. You're a creator, passionate about everything design, and obsess about details. You can see the big picture as well as the tiniest detail. You're an expert in designing interactions as well as in detailing the visual aspects. You understand business goals in the context of the product area and collaborate with multiple stakeholders to design solutions.

  • Lead new creative and holistic thinking across diverse product releases, platforms, and devices
  • Drive the direction, style, and methodology of design and usability
  • Develop a deep understanding of customers and business priorities by working closely with Product Managers and Business stakeholders
  • Strategize rolling out a major design change in multiple phases by breaking it down into logical design iterations
  • Create delightful and compelling, user-centered experiences across interfaces – Desktop, Mobile Web, Mobile Applications, Virtual / Augmented Reality devices (If and When)
  • Develop a universal design language and UI/UX principles to be adopted across the various components of our company
  • Create clear wireframes, user flows, site maps, and graphic visualizations to prototype and communicate ideas
  • Demonstrate out-of-the box thinking while also delivering solutions that meet user and business goals
  • Foster Edureka’s culture and principles within the group while setting new standards in executive and operational excellence
  • Ensure that every designer on the team is creating work of the highest quality and, most importantly, that they are creating work they are proud of
primaryrequirement:

  • User centric and obsessed with customer experience
  • Experience designing complex applications for web and mobile
  • Experience in applying user research, user needs validation and usability evaluation
  • Experience of working with developers within an agile development process to ensure a polished and easy-to-use end product
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate design decisions
  • Startup Experience is a big plus

  • Very Strong Portfolio showcasing creative, contemporary design across a breath of business verticals
  • Ability to be self-directed and fine dealing with Ambiguity

title: Senior Experience Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for a Senior Experience Designer who has an eagerness to jump in and solve problems and a unique combination of Interaction design and ability in interface design. A talented designer who can quickly come up with game changing ideas for our products. Design new products: You’ll be responsible in guiding the creation process: conceiving features, iterating on prototypes, and crafting elegant solutions on the product. You’ll focus on intuitive interactions, but you’ll also gain broad exposure to user research, branding, and systems thinking.

  • Put Users first - You will be crafting experiences that will help humans better collaborate and tell stories with their travel. Able to quickly come up with multiple design possibilities. Take it to the users quickly and test them out, Analyze data to make decisions.
  • Give redBus an identity - You’ll have a unique opportunity to various team to enforce a consistent aesthetic and authentic voice across all our user touch point: UX, marketing pages, emails, and more.
  • Work closely with engineers - Push the boundaries of technical feasibility working with the teams; you’ll work closely with engineers to stay aware of technical constraints (and new possibilities!).
  • Strong attention to detail - Highly developed organizational skills including the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. A self-starter who will bring original ideas and fresh approaches to each project they work on. Must be an ego-free, thick-skinned person who can take and give clear feedback.
primaryrequirement:
• Strong UX and Interaction design portfolio with at least 2 year of industry work experience
  • Experience with the end-to-end process of designing, shipping, and refining a product
  • (Bonus) Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, so you can iterate on high-fidelity prototypes yourself

title: UX Lead
primaryresponsibility:
A Lead Designer is a Senior Designer who is the single point of contact for the client for all project related queries. In addition to designing, you will also play the role of a Project Manager. As a project manager, you are involved in the complete project lifecycle. You will be reporting directly to the Design Head. A Lead UX Designer will be responsible for insuring on time and quality delivery of all deliverables for the project even though he may not actually work on all of them. A Project Lead will have the following responsibilities.

  • Conduct or guide in conducting Usability Audits
  • Conduct or guide in conducting and executing research processes
  • As the project manager Lead the project to on-time and quality delivery as agreed by the client Manage different stages of a project Negotiate expectations with client Report periodic status to client and other stakeholders Raise and negotiate issues and risks with client and other stakeholders Manage delivery and growth of team members Manage profitability of the project
  • Good Communication skills
  • Guide and mentor junior team members
  • Stay up-to-date with latest achievements, best practices and trends in design
  • Needs to have the technical competency to deliver the items mentioned above

title: Lead Product Designer
primaryresponsibility:
• Are driven to discover, understand and design for real human needs and behaviors using data and user research methods
  • Generate concepts from sketches to prototypes
  • Plan and run user tests and other design research
  • Have great taste and a passion for craft
  • Have a strong portfolio of digital products that you've designed and helped ship
  • Love collaborating in multi-disciplinary teams. You’ll be working across our design, product and development teams, shaping how the world sees, perceives and interacts with us.
  • Thrive in a Lean UX culture
  • Are slick with all the usual tools of the trade. Extra nice (but not obligatory) would be some prototyping and motion design
primaryperks:
Competitive Salary
Employee Stock Options

primaryrequirement: You are a passionate User Experience Designer and can you make your products usable and delightful. This role demands a balance of great execution and bold innovation. You will completely own one vertical of our product roadmap.

title: Lead / Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for UX Designers who will work with our world class dev teams to revolutionize the world of real time communications. The products comprise of mobile, desktop and web interfaces. You will be a part of a team of passionate product designers, Interaction designers, software developers etc and participate in the entire development lifecycle, including strategy, vision, design, development. You will be expected to research and apply user-centered design processes to create high quality user experiences, and reusable mocks and wireframe templates for various products. You will also be involved in mentorship and training of peers as well as members of other teams on relevant topics. As a Senior Interaction Designer, you will work with motivated individuals who are passionate-beyond-measure about usability, to deliver a kick-ass user experience for our revolutionary suite of products and services. You will be responsible for the entire UX lifecycle of one or more projects, including:

  • Contributing to product strategy and conceptualization and prioritization of features
  • Gathering requirements and defining user stories
  • Creating UX prototypes and wireframes, interface copywriting and product communication
  • Usability testing (pre and post development)
  • Reviewing product analytics to derive behavioral insights for adoption, growth and engagement strategies
  • Interviewing users, gathering feedback and providing suggestions to management
  • Competition review, comparison and analysis
  • Coordinating creation of visual designs, assets, logos etc for each iteration
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.
We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• You have 3+ years of experience in user interface design and usability engineering for web and desktop applications
  • You have mastered the art of information architecture and usability engineering and can always come up with a structured, logical, intuitive, simple and clean way of translating user stories into text, screens and flows.
  • You are very comfortable with creating user interface prototypes and wireframes on paper, powerpoint, visio or prototyping tools such as Axure / Balsamiq
  • Your oral and written communication and articulation skills are immaculate and you can always come up with the perfect text for any given interface
  • You are extremely process oriented - and tend to create reusable templates, effective guidelines, best practices, training modules etc.
  • You have a reasonable understanding of SOA and Web 2.0 concepts and are reasonably comfortable with HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • You understand the nuances of integrating user interfaces into code. You also keep in touch with technology advancements and understand the impact of new standards on product design (for eg RIA or HTML 5.0 etc)
  • You are an avid reader of Web 2.0 blogs and usability related material

title: Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for an experienced UX designer who will help us build our UX capabilities so that we can deliver the right user experience to our clients. As the UX designer, you will design creative solutions that promote user adoption, self-service, and ease of use to support the business needs by following a user-centered design process, understanding real users – their goals, aptitudes, experiences, needs, and motivations. The UX designer will work collaboratively with other teams taking a project from conception, through analysis, prototyping, visual design, finally to implementation whilst ensuring the clients’ needs remain the focus.

  • Design and deliver compelling, elegant, pleasurable and sophisticated end-to-end user experience solutions for multiple products and platforms, from assessing and defining customer needs to delivering concepts, to prioritizing features, to presenting and evaluating prototypes, to validating user experience feedback.
  • Work closely and efficiently with a cross-functional and interdisciplinary team that includes other Designers, Developers, Project and Product Management, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance, and Business Partners among other team members.
  • Develop expert-level knowledge of competitive and complementary products for the purpose of bringing new design ideas to each project. Recognize and communicate user experience risks as they arise and make design recommendations that take into account tradeoffs, scope creep, iterative design, phased releases.
  • Quickly and iteratively create artefacts that illuminate user tasks, define proposed product functionality, turn business requirements into conceptualizations of the proposed product, and effectively communicate the overall user experience to the project team and our business partners. Gather and track feedback and key design decisions generated from continuous review of these artefacts to iteratively improve the user experience with interactive products.
  • Maintain knowledge of current and emerging design principles and best practices in user interface design, interaction design, information architecture, usability theory, and evaluation techniques.
primaryrequirement:
• 4+ years of experience working as a User Experience Designer, Interaction Designer, Information Architect (or closely related field) in the design of websites, web applications, desktop, and/or mobile applications.
  • A critical eye for clean visual designs. Practical knowledge of user research methods, including lab-based usability studies, field studies, and usability inspections (heuristic evaluations or cognitive walkthroughs)
  • Deep understanding of UX principles and best practices, and the latest trends in design and user experience along with knowledge of related disciplines such as information architecture, interaction design and end user research.
  • Communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills, including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
  • Expertise in comparing, contrasting, and prioritizing among alternative approaches to meeting design objectives, and using judgment to suggest solutions to design problems that optimize among customer needs, business constraints, and technological realities.
  • Analytical ability, especially with regard to observation of user behavior.

Myntra.com is looking for star design specialists to shape the future of e-commerce in India and transform fashion lifestyle online retailing.
You would work and effectively communicate with Engineering and Product Management, to plan, prioritize, and deliver deliverables that realize the design vision. You would need to be able to produce mood boards, storyboards, design briefs, sketch, create visual language guidelines, and other artifacts required to develop and evolve user experience designs. You would leverage modern web / mobile technologies to define innovative user interfaces and interaction models that result in realization of business and end-user goals.
primaryrequirement:
You're a creator, passionate about everything design, and obsess about details. You can see the big picture as well as the tiniest detail. You're an expert in designing interactions as well as in detailing the visual aspects.

  • Experience designing complex applications for web and mobile
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate design decisions
  • Proficiency in simplifying complex information for users. Developing information architecture for complex business applications with multiple stakeholders
  • Proficiency creating design deliverables like wireframes, mockups, prototypes etc.
  • Proficiency with Sketch and Adobe suite of applications
  • At least 4 years of relevant experience and B.Des / M.Des / GDPD from a reputed institution (A wicked sense of humor is a bonus!) This is a unique opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing startup environment with extraordinary stability.

title: Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking at a young designer and communication enthusiast who wants to work in the premium and luxury space. As with any good design role, there are no set rules or boundaries that you are limited to at The Man Company. For greater clarity, you can find some of the responsibilities that you'll have.

 

Brand Communication

Conceptualize and design brand specific communication that goes with our brand’s positioning.

 

Digital Design

E-Mail designs, social media posts, website landing pages, blog posts and anything else that you believe will further the brand in the digital space

 

Copy

We'd prefer it if you are adept at English, love reading and have a standpoint on what constitutes good copy.

You will tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for our users around the world. title: UX Lead
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for the first person in our UX team. You get to own and set the UX culture at Mech Mocha. You will work with product owners and game designers to understand their vision for gameplay and translate the same into flows and screens that our players interact with. UX flows in games are complex as it involves multiple things including gameplay, store screens, content prompts, sale events, player profile, multiplayer mode etc. If you want to imagine what it would look like working on UX for games - here’s a screenshot of UX Flows in our current game and honestly we haven't even scratched the surface here. We’re looking for humble but ambitious UX designer who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.

  • Work closely with product managers, game designers, artists, and engineers on high-scope design challenges and feature sets
  • Set clear experiential goals, follow-through on detailed design work
  • Work with other discipline leads on establishing design standards and patterns
  • Take ownership of the entire user interface pipeline on an upcoming video game title, from design to implementation
  • Understand user data and improve the UX accordingly.
primaryperks:

  • Solve tough problems with a bunch of passionate and talented colleagues. And one happy dog – Yoda says woof!

  • Strong understanding of how to objectively evaluate a user experience for learnability and usability, and then adjust the design of the UI based on empirical data
  • Ability to continually re-evaluate, simplify, and improve existing designs to increase user acceptance

  • Scripting experience (C++, C#, Lua, Python, etc.) or experience with prototyping tools

title: UX Lead
primaryresponsibility:
We’re looking for experienced UX designers to create world-class UX in our upcoming games. You will collaborate closely with product owners and game designers, understand and further develop their vision for the game, and translate it into experiences and flows that millions of players will interact with.

  • As the UX owner of a game, you will be expected to play a versatile role: structured problem-solving and developing creative solutions in the concept stage to UI/art production and making engineering trade-offs in the implementation phase
  • Go from brainstorming with low fidelity sketches to producing high fidelity, interactive prototypes
  • Be obsessed with quality: every micro-interaction needs to right and edge cases do matter
  • Be at the centre of all the action: work closely with product managers, game designers, artists, and engineers. Manage high expectations, differing opinions, difficult constraints and hard timelines!
  • Build a UX culture that emphasises data and user research more than opinions; systems thinking and Indian cultural references more than global trends
primaryperks:
Come and build path-breaking games at Mech Mocha! #MakeinIndia #MakeforIndia #MakeIndiaPlay

  • Create truly local mobile entertainment for your friends, family and millions of Indians; get a shot at redefining the gaming industry

  • Competitive salary and significant equity – we know building a great company is a multiplayer effort!
primaryrequirement:
• 3+ years of UX design experience creating consumer products/games including at least 1 year focused on mobile apps. Multiple success stories of data-driven and iterative product development
  • “Product Owner” mindset and experience: responsible for key features especially building them from scratch, driving design across the product lifecycle, hands-on collaboration with engineering and QA, identifying opportunities, influencing the roadmap
  • Strong problem-solving skills: shepherding ideas from the concept stage, understanding problems deeply through user research and analytics, synthesizing and exploring diverse approaches and understanding trade-offs (all this before even opening Sketch to starting “designing”!)
  • Excellent grasp of fundamentals: usability, graphic design, motion/animation, consumer behavior patterns from psychology and behavioural economics
  • A deep sense of ownership and collaboration – take initiative, work hard, learn and unlearn, communicate clearly, be nice and have fun!

  • You’re a passionate gamer OR have worked in a gaming/entertainment company
  • PS: We absolutely do NOT require experience at a gaming company. We do require a curious and playful attitude :)

title: iOS Developer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for an iOS developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. Working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure.

  • Responsible for entire application lifecycle and work closely with the team and projectmanagers to deliver high quality applications in the stipulated time
  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform
  • Collaborate with team to define, design, and ship new features
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation
  • Archive, Upload the application on Test Flight and App Store.
primaryperks:
In our journey towards building something sustainable and profitable, we make the most of flexible roles, a fun work environment and the freedom to experiment.

At HDFC RED, you’ll be guided and given the opportunity to find your own way of managing tasks and delivering results, rather than simply being told what to do. As part of a dynamic and diverse team, your strategies and suggestions will soon grow to be every bit as colorful as the people you’re surrounded by.

When it comes to your mission specialists, you’ll be challenged to stand up and fight for the ideas you believe in. And just in case a brainstorming session ever gets a bit too heated, you can always cool down together over a nice icy brew!
With the weight of the prefix in our name, we’ve strived to make own unique mark and enable our team to do the same.

We’ve even said goodbye to those old school ways of glorifying grades, and placed capabilities over qualifications, all to make sure we bring opportunity to the right people, and the right people to us!
primaryrequirement:
• Proficient with Objective-C and Swift (version depends on project), and Cocoa Touch
  • Deep knowledge of Objective-C,Swift and Xcode, including modern syntax and blocks-UIKit, Core Graphics, Auto Layout, Storyboards
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
  • Familiarity with REST APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
  • Knowledge to integrate 3rd party libraries and APIs (FB, Crashlytics etc)
  • Experience with push notifications and iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc
  • Adaptable to new technologies and changes
  • Good communication skills.

title: Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
User-experience designers are responsible for creating the look and feel of a specific computer interface. This allows them to navigate the functionality of that interface and produce a certain type of human-computer interaction. These designers generally work on teams, applying their skills to a website or computer product, such as a piece of software. These teams can include different types of designers. 

Interaction designers work primarily with navigation structures and interface functions. Their work is foundational to the site or product being created; every other aspect of the design experience goes on top of their storyboards and mockups for how the design will actually work. The interaction designer is the member of the team that spends the most time with user research, testing and psychology. The information designer deals mainly with content specific to the site or product, as well as working up user assistance tools. The visual designer is concerned with the aesthetics of the final product. 

Despite these differences, user-experience design boils down to the task of translating the requirements for a product's optimal functionality into interactive solutions. This entails the incorporation of market research and psychology, design of the human-computer interface for optimal effectiveness, inclusion of easily navigable content, and graphic design and finishing for maximum aesthetic appeal.
primaryrequirement:
• Ideally 4+ years of experience in UX, Interaction Design and Usability
  • Design Education in UX, HCI, Interaction will be a big advantage
  • Good Communication skills is a must
professions: UX Design$$$Interaction Design$$$Product Design$$$Mobile Design$$$Web Design

primaryperks:
Culture @ Nearbuy

Imagine being surrounded all day by street-smart, confident and quirky people. Even if you’re not standing on the sets of ‘How I Met Your Mother’. Seriously, the last time a Nearbuy employee called someone Sir, s/he was probably standing in front of a professor explaining the doodle on the note they were passing in class.)

 It’s also a place where people like to build new stuff (not necessarily out of Lego) and believe in odd things – like there’s something new to be learned every day and that ideas can come from anywhere. Honestly, we love exchanging ideas and everyone has an ‘open-door’ policy, whether it’s your reporting manager or the friendly CEO next door.

Actually, that was a lie – we don’t have an open-door policy. We don’t even have doors. We’re cool like that.

Fun @ Nearbuy

At Nearbuy (formerly known as Groupon India), fun takes all kinds of bizarre turns. Whether it’s odd events (read Twin Day, Halloween Parties, Fashion Disaster, Retro Day), unexpected cake, random photo shoots (if you own a DSLR, you are our new best friend), stand-up comedy one-offs, well, you get the gist. Oh, and we take a very out-of-the-box approach to work. In this case, the box being the office…Because we have tons of team outings, get togethers and trips. And this is not including the annual offsite where employees from all over the country come together for a weekend of activities, talent shows, dancing, awards, discussions and much more.

Tips from a Nearbuy Veteran

  • Everyone needs a friend to stay by their side through late nights. Make coffee yours
  • That report you stayed up all night preparing? There’s a good chance it’s going to be scrapped – we love reinventing and soon you will too (insert evil laugh here)
  • We believe in casual dressing. But just to be clear, casual doesn't include boxers, feathers, oh god, we're giving you ideas!!!
  • It may be a bit difficult separating your professional life from your personal life – because at Nearbuy, it’s like working with family. But in a good way

What would be awesome?

  • You are a Dilbert fan and a Batman fan and are not in therapy because of this
  • You do a little dance every time you get a good deal in the vegetable market
  • You are so data driven, you stalk people online before agreeing to a blind date with them

title: Lead / Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for UX Designers who will work with our world class dev teams to revolutionize the world of real time communications. The products comprise of mobile, desktop and web interfaces. You will be a part of a team of passionate product designers, Interaction designers, software developers etc and participate in the entire development lifecycle, including strategy, vision, design, development. You will be expected to research and apply user-centered design processes to create high quality user experiences, and reusable mocks and wireframe templates for various products. You will also be involved in mentorship and training of peers as well as members of other teams on relevant topics. As a Senior Interaction Designer, you will work with motivated individuals who are passionate-beyond-measure about usability, to deliver a kick-ass user experience for our revolutionary suite of products and services. You will be responsible for the entire UX lifecycle of one or more projects, including:

  • Contributing to product strategy and conceptualization and prioritization of features
  • Gathering requirements and defining user stories
  • Creating UX prototypes and wireframes, interface copywriting and product communication
  • Usability testing (pre and post development)
  • Reviewing product analytics to derive behavioral insights for adoption, growth and engagement strategies
  • Interviewing users, gathering feedback and providing suggestions to management
  • Competition review, comparison and analysis
  • Coordinating creation of visual designs, assets, logos etc for each iteration
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.
We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• You have 3+ years of experience in user interface design and usability engineering for web and desktop applications

  • You are very comfortable with creating user interface prototypes and wireframes on paper, powerpoint, visio or prototyping tools such as Axure / Balsamiq
  • Your oral and written communication and articulation skills are immaculate and you can always come up with the perfect text for any given interface
  • You are extremely process oriented - and tend to create reusable templates, effective guidelines, best practices, training modules etc.
  • You have a reasonable understanding of SOA and Web 2.0 concepts and are reasonably comfortable with HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • You understand the nuances of integrating user interfaces into code. You also keep in touch with technology advancements and understand the impact of new standards on product design (for eg RIA or HTML 5.0 etc)
  • You are an avid reader of Web 2.0 blogs and usability related material

title: Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility:
• You must love fast-paced work environments. Like emergency wards. Only, you know, without people dying and stuff. Because whether it’s the demonetization news that broke out at night or the US election results that broke out in the morning, you must be ready with a cup of coffee, and an idea that has the potential to break the internet. No pressure!

  • You must be a little eccentric to be able to keep up with the pace at which the marketing team comes up with campaigns, and design all the collaterals that go with it

  • Do you watch a lot of videos and think you could have made them way better? Well, that’s the only kind of arrogance we like! Making, editing sound and video creatively and within budget is a must.
primaryperks:
Culture @ Nearbuy

Imagine being surrounded all day by street-smart, confident and quirky people. Even if you’re not standing on the sets of ‘How I Met Your Mother’. Seriously, the last time a Nearbuy employee called someone Sir, s/he was probably standing in front of a professor explaining the doodle on the note they were passing in class.)

 It’s also a place where people like to build new stuff (not necessarily out of Lego) and believe in odd things – like there’s something new to be learned every day and that ideas can come from anywhere. Honestly, we love exchanging ideas and everyone has an ‘open-door’ policy, whether it’s your reporting manager or the friendly CEO next door.

Actually, that was a lie – we don’t have an open-door policy. We don’t even have doors. We’re cool like that.

Fun @ Nearbuy

At Nearbuy (formerly known as Groupon India), fun takes all kinds of bizarre turns. Whether it’s odd events (read Twin Day, Halloween Parties, Fashion Disaster, Retro Day), unexpected cake, random photo shoots (if you own a DSLR, you are our new best friend), stand-up comedy one-offs, well, you get the gist. Oh, and we take a very out-of-the-box approach to work. In this case, the box being the office…Because we have tons of team outings, get togethers and trips. And this is not including the annual offsite where employees from all over the country come together for a weekend of activities, talent shows, dancing, awards, discussions and much more.

Tips from a Nearbuy Veteran

  • Everyone needs a friend to stay by their side through late nights. Make coffee yours
  • That report you stayed up all night preparing? There’s a good chance it’s going to be scrapped – we love reinventing and soon you will too (insert evil laugh here)
  • We believe in casual dressing. But just to be clear, casual doesn't include boxers, feathers, oh god, we're giving you ideas!!!
  • It may be a bit difficult separating your professional life from your personal life – because at Nearbuy, it’s like working with family. But in a good way
primaryrequirement:

  • Demonstrated ability and working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-changing environment
  • Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions, think strategically, and maintain accuracy
  • Strong and innovative approach to problem solving and finding solutions
  • Excellent communicator (written and verbal, formal and informal)
  • Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution
  • Would be great to have someone from an Art school

What would be awesome?

  • You are a Dilbert fan and a Batman fan and are not in therapy because of this
  • You do a little dance every time you get a good deal in the vegetable market
  • You are so data driven, you stalk people online before agreeing to a blind date with them
  • You love fast-paced work environments. Like emergency wards. Only, you know, without people dying and stuff

Selection Process

The selection process is fairly simple:

  • The profile of the candidate will be screened and shortlisted
  • The shortlisted candidates will go through a telephonic round
  • A design exercise would be given to the designer
  • The shortlisted candidate will go through 2-3 rounds of discussion with the design and marketing team

The UX designer will be a member of our core design team and will work closely with product and engineering teams to research and design experiences for our customer facing android app, seller apps and associated platforms.

Process

primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for highly passionate frontend engineers to make an uber cool user interface for Doctors to visualize and interact with medical images and videos. The engineering team of SigTuple is responsible for building the ecosystem for helping doctors visualize and annotate data and medical reports on a large scale, hence we are on a mission to build elegant user interfaces for interpreting numeric data and visuals. You will be creating interactive and involved interfaces for AI based solutions which will be used by medical specialists. Apart from building an intuitive UI, an added challenge in this role is to support complex image and video handling on the client side in an optimized manner. You should be an active practitioner of front-end engineering excellence: keeping a high bar for quality, consistency, maintainability, site latency, efficiency, security and all the other things that make great user interfaces amazing. In addition, you should contribute elegant, practical code to the corpus of the project. If you are Creative and are impelled to create great user experience and are keen to make a difference in a unique way, then we are looking for you….

  • Design and implement all user interfaces required for an AI platform.
  • Interact with product team to crystallize UI/UX requirements
  • Own the UI technology stack, introduce and utilise pertinent frameworks and technologies which are scalable and flexible enough to cater to the platform’s roadmap.
primaryrequirement:
• Experience of UI technologies with development of responsive web applications
  • Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript libraries like jQuery
  • Great Knowledge of at least one Javascript framework -AngularJS, ReactJS
  • Experience in development of Android/IOS apps is preferred
  • Good knowledge of UI design principles, patterns and best practices
  • Graduate/Post graduate degree in any engineering or scientific discipline
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in UI, front-end development
  • A portfolio of creating visually appealing and interactive user interfaces
  • Be an innovative and creative thinker, somebody who is not afraid to try something new and inspire others to do so
  • Thrive in a fast-paced and fun environment
  • Work with a bunch of data scientist geeks and disruptors striving for a big cause

title: Art Director
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for a supremely Creative Designer for our Bangalore office, an artist with a strong background in designing for consumer-facing brands. Our Design Consultants have strong passion for design storytelling, and will ensure everything it takes to make it pixel perfect.

As a Design Consultant, your responsibility will be to ensure the brand, graphics, illustrations, logos, icons, and everything else you create aligns with the style & mission of our clientele. You must be proficient with design principles such as typography, illustration, imagery, content, and composition, and excel in blending them to tell a brand's story.

  • Excellent problem solving skills
