title: Principal / Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for well-rounded UX Designer to join our awesome UX team, who can help us revamp our EPS productivity suite offering, which will have the BEST-IN CLASS experience. EPS Productivity Suites provides out-of-the-box workflows with MIS at the core for Print and Packaging customers. We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic and passionate, whoknows: content strategy, user research, usability, interaction design, information architecture and visual design. You should be capable of realizing our crazy concepts into, diagrams, interaction flows, functional specs, wireframes and pixel perfect designs. Loves to build slick, simple, intuitive and visually stunning interfaces. Are creative and has an “everything is possible” attitude. Strives for quality and has extreme attention to details, pixel perfect. We’d like someone:

  • Exceptionally strong conceptualization capabilities, excellent problem-solving skills, and ability to work well in a collaborative team environment
  • Ensure the experience vision is guided by business and market requirements and driven by experience insights
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and empathize with the user, to simplify the process, and to interpret that into a systematic user-centered UX solution
  • An exceptional understanding of fundamental design disciplines (typography, composition, color and animation) and principals (affordance, clustering, progressive disclosure, consistency, etc...)
  • Drive and represent design direction to team members, senior management, and key stakeholders
  • Direct and develop UX artifacts including personas streamlined scenarios, storyboards, information architecture, wireframes, visuals and interactive prototypes
  • Understand the array of technical constraints, user goals, and business requirements that shape customer-focused service products
primaryrequirement:
• Proven industry experience including working with product/design teams through at least one full development cycle
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills
  • Solid academic background in human-computer interaction or related field. BS or MS in Computer Science or related field.

title: Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
If you are passionate about designing user interfaces that solves the challenging problems users face and wow them with the simplicity and use of use, this job is for you. MindTickle is looking to add a rock-star UX Designer to join our team! As a UX Designer, you are accountable for clean, minimal and engaging user experience of our web application and mobile application.

  • Work closely with Product Managers/Business Heads, to understand business objectives and create effective UX design solutions for aforementioned objectives
  • Develop a deep understanding of customers and Gathering and analyzing user requirements to drive key design decision
  • Demonstrate out-of-the box thinking while also delivering solutions that meet user and business goals
  • Develop a universal design language and UI/UX principles to be adopted across the various components of our company
  • Designing flawless information architecture and workflows for intuitive and effortless navigation
  • Deliver design solutions in form of design spec, taskflow diagrams, wireframes and Development ready UI
  • Follow iterative and lean UX approach while designing features
  • Foster MindTickle’s culture and principles within the group while setting new standards in executive and operational excellence

  • Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail
  • User centric and obsessed with customer experience

  • Experience in building scalable designs and identifying the corner cases where your design would fail - in a jiffy

title: Experience Manager
primaryresponsibility:
The Manager: Experience Design is responsible to ensure that every product achieves the users specified goals with efficiency, effectiveness, and satisfaction and delivers a delightful customer experience. The person in this role establishes user-centred analysis, design, best practices and standards within every UX design project. The Manager: Experience Design manages and actively participates in multiple simultaneous UX projects to meet project schedules with highest quality and within budget. The User Experience Architect Manager recruits, hires, and mentors interaction designers, and visual designers, user experience researchers and oversees their deployment and performance on multiple software development projects.

  • Lead the UX Architects to attract and retain the best UX talent; Mentor, inspire, and provide guidelines to a rapidly growing team UX professionals on projects, and their career path.
  • In collaboration with leadership and EY business, define and refine standards, processes and practices with regards to user research, design, and usability studies.
  • Provide leadership in enabling efficient employment and recruitment activities, provide coaching and guidance to a team of UX professionals and promote staff training and development.
  • Lead the UX Architects on budgeting, project pricing, team utilization, realization, expenditures, and staffing issues
  • We work globally and the corresponding quality control goes without saying
  • We are NOT an IT company. We are business advisors and we are pioneering the principle of “Design led Business”
  • We integrate business, humanities and technology with the underlying fabric of design
  • Creating, surviving and managing disruption (business as well as technological) is one of our challenges
  • Our technological exposure spans in areas like Artificial Intelligence, Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality, Brain Computer Interfacing, Machine Learning etc.
primaryperks:

  • Proficiency in tools like Axure, Solidworks, Rhino, Maya, Cinema 4D, ProE
  • Have exposure to Arduino, Raspberry pi, Wunderbar or any other IoT platforms and technologies
primaryrequirement:

  • Demonstrated thought leadership and UX advocacy in the User Experience Design of software applications
  • Expertise in full spectrum of Software User experience design process, techniques and methodologies
  • Extensive Software UX Management experience in Estimating, Planning, Managing and Delivery of multiple large UX engagements, relationships and teams
  • Expertise in large spectrum of Software User experience design processes, techniques and methodologies
  • Considerable People management expertise demonstrated through UX team building and mentoring activities
  • Expertise in implementing various User research and analysis techniques including Ethnographic Research, Personas, user task-flows, and usage scenarios through goal oriented processes
  • Experience in communicating and collaborating with senior executives, product managers, design managers and other stakeholder teams
  • Demonstrated ability in UX focused participation in Software Requirement elicitation
  • Demonstrated capability in managing & developing User interface prototypes of varying Fidelity
  • Experience in delivering Product Branding & User Experience definition through brand expressions and visual design style guides
  • Experience in conducting User experience Heuristics Evaluation, User Testing, Analysis and Troubleshooting
  • Expertise in human interface guidelines, standards, and best practices as they apply to platforms
  • Experience in setting up UX practice and usability teams in other organizations is a plus
  • Excellent communication, presentation and organizational skills, with attention to detail
  • An extensive work portfolio with demonstrated examples of designing great user-cantered experiences for both enterprise and consumer applications is a must Analytical/Decision making responsibilities
  • Demonstrate entrepreneurial spirit and drive in creating new business and uncovering untapped market potential
  • Enable team collaboration working with cross-functional teams demonstrated by working effectively in multi-country /distributed teams building global applications

title: Lead / Senior Product Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for Full-Stack Designers who will work with our world class dev teams to revolutionize the world of real time communications. The products comprise of mobile, desktop and web interfaces. You will be a part of a team of passionate product designers, Interaction designers, software developers etc. and participate in the entire development lifecycle, including strategy, vision, design, development.

As a Senior Product Designer, you will work with motivated individuals who are passionate beyond-measure about usability, to deliver a kick-ass user experience for our revolutionary suite of products and services. You will be responsible for the entire UX lifecycle of one or more projects, including:

  • Participate in all the phases of the product, from discovery to delivery to iteration. You'll work closely with Product Managers, Interaction Designers, Visual Designers and Front-end Engineers to build a robust design system and a world-class product.
  • You will be responsible for designing a holistic experience taking into consideration various user touchpoints, and understanding the user's journey over time as they interact with the product.
  • Rapidly iterate and prototype new features. You should know how to use prototypes as a primary canvas for communicating ideas both internally and externally.
  • You will be involved in user testing to be able to constantly validate and refine ideas as well as collect new insights. You should be able to discard ideas, no matter how good they are, if they fail to drive value to our end users.
  • You should exhibit fluency in both Interaction and Visual Design, knowing when to dive into wireframes and when to plunge into pixel-perfection.
  • As a design lead, inspire and collaborate with other designers to make their work better
  • Own the design process end-to-end – translating research into actionable insights, then designing workflows and design to build product features.
  • Deliver excellent experiences to our customers through both your own craft of design, strategy and execution, as well as by fostering a team of top-notch designers.
  • Direct and deliver design strategies, frameworks and deliverables on a broad range of projects, near-term and future.
  • Work closely with engineers as they build the design
  • Contribute to and participate in a collaborative, knowledge-sharing design community.
  • Oversee the evolution and implementation of our brand design guidelines for all marketing and communication channels

You will be expected to research and apply user-centered design processes to create high quality user experiences, and reusable mocks and wireframe templates for various products. You will also be involved in mentorship and training of peers as well as members of other teams on relevant topics.
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.

 

We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• For the Lead position - 5+ years of experience in design positions in successful high-growth ecommerce/internet, online media or software product companies. 3+ years leading and managing teams
  • Demonstrated leader with ability to attract outstanding talent, create and sustain a culture of high performance
  • Strong technical ability; capable of conducting mission-critical design discussions with Product Managers and business leads
  • Skilled at implementing and optimizing organizational structure and creative development processes that allow the design team to scale with the company
  • Product-minded design leader with the confidence and ability to be a thought-partner to business leads and CEO
  • Track record of translating product vision into actionable plans that lead to the creation of high-quality user experience and engagement.
  • A very strong understanding of interaction and visual design concepts
  • The ability to clearly communicate and document your design decisions
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Understanding of the nuances of each platform, be it Desktop, Android or iOS
  • Mastery of design tools including Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, Principle etc.
professions: Interaction Design$$$Product Design$$$UI Design$$$UX Design$$$Mobile Design

title: Senior Graphic Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We’re looking for an amazing and passionate Graphic Designer to help create designs that tell the stories of our services and their usability for our users. We need someone who can push themselves and everyone around them to perform at a higher level. For the desired position, the employee must provide strong conceptual thinking, solid design skills and expertise in creative design programs. Push the boundaries of creative excellence and ensure the delivery of required results.

 

  • Conceptualize, develop, and implement original digital graphics
  • Manage a high-volume of graphic design requests under tight deadlines
  • Createanimations / Motion Graphics / GIFs
  • Graphic preparation, color production, and layout
  • Commit to design integrity and innovation that aligns to company objectives and brand standards
  • Provide proactive and continuing troubleshooting support, following up on persistent and serious issues and helping to resolve complex issues as they arise
  • Have the ability to take a brief and deliver inspiring, provocative, and disruptive results, in short amounts of time, on tasks large and small
  • Get excited by producing beautiful and thought-provoking designs
  • Be a quick thinker, and an even faster doer
  • Be innately curious about life and aware of the latest market and media trends, new aesthetics, materials, graphic styles, typography, and most importantly tackling new challenges
primaryrequirement:

title: Senior UI / UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
UX at PayU is a unique setup, which is involved with not only day to day UI work butstrategically influencing product strategy across verticals. With direct reporting to the CEOthis team enjoys autonomy which allows for key infrastructure such as a testing lab,dedicated research budgets etc. Led by a stalwart in the UX industry, team members enjoythe opportunity of getting direct mentoring and developing core competencies in theircareer path. The work undertaken by this team is heavily UX process driven, where teamsfrequently conduct research, create personas, design task flows, run experiments (MVPs)and usability testing. UX designers are involved in every step of the process for buildingPayU products. If you are serious about growing as a UX practitioner, then this is the placefor you.

  • Interact directly with senior stakeholders to understand business intent
  • Create personas, flows, journeys to define the user
  • Conduct research with actual users to understand their mental model
  • Inform product/business/marketing strategy through insights captured through userresearch
  • Participate in strategic experiments to come up with new and innovative products
  • Create wireframes, interactive prototypes and visual designs for product experiences
  • Conduct usability tests on product flows and designs to identify areas ofimprovement
  • Develop design guidelines and collaborate with tech and product teams to buildproducts
primaryrequirement:
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, graphic design, or related fieldexperience

 

Experience: 3-8 years of experience designing digital experiences and products,including web, mobile, and desktop applications

 

Skills: Advanced ability to design and prototype using Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite,Principle and InVision (or Proto.io).

 

Behavior

  • Ability to work in ambiguous data environments. All data points may not be fullyavailable. It is important for this role to be able to work with ambiguity
  • Strong ownership of the full product experience
  • Proactive & Self-motivated to drive work without close supervision
  • Ready, set, go! We take initiative with or without direction
  • Ability to manage relationships with stakeholders, peers and subordinates

title: Lead Product Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Design at Hike is a unique setup, which is involved with not only day to day UI work butstrategically influencing product strategy across verticals. With direct reporting to the CEOthis team enjoys autonomy and high responsibilities.

You're a leader, a creator, passionate about everything design. You can see the big picture as well as the tiniest detail. You interface directly with Engineering and Product Management team and undertaken work that is heavily UX process driven, where teamsfrequently conduct research, create personas, design task flows, run experiments (MVPs)and usability testing. UX designers are involved in every step of the process for buildingHike products.

  • Design and deliver compelling, elegant, pleasurable and sophisticated end-to-end user experience solutions
  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience
  • Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering
  • Conceptualise original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design problems.
  • Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
  • Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive stakeholders
  • Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards
primaryrequirement:
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Interaction design, UXDesign orDesigning for Digital Experiences

 

Experience: 3 to 8 years of experience designing digital experiences and products across Mobile and Smaller screens

 

  • An excellent on-line portfolio showcasing user experience and visual design work for touch devices
  • You have mastered the art of information architecture and usability engineering and can always come up with a structured, logical, intuitive, simple and clean way of translating user stories into text, screens and flows.
  • Should be able to rapidly prototype ideas; pen and paper will do for mockups. Should be familiar with prototyping tools or front-end code for higher fidelity prototyping
  • Enthusiasm for an iterative design process, driven by group critique
  • Can speak articulately about the design and research work, represent a variety of viewpoints,clarify direction, and resolve conflicts professionally
  • Great collaboration skills
  • A passion for Hike, its products, and its customers is a must

(A wicked sense of humor is a bonus!)

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing startup environment with extraordinary stability.

title: Senior Front-End Engineer
primaryresponsibility:
Flock is seeking an experienced Engineer to join the Flock Web and Desktop Product Team. This team is responsible for building and maintaining Flock Web, Flock Chrome Extension, Flock Mac App and Flock Windows App. The product is as complex and challenging as front-end engineering could get. We are looking for engineers who are passionate about solving complex problems and building complex, performant and beautiful frontend products.

  • Participate in the front-end web-development project life-cycle from pitch/prototyping through definition and design to build, integration, QA and delivery
  • Build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions
  • Identify and communicate front-end best practices
  • Work closely with product management and UX design teams to define and refine feature specifications
  • Analyze and improve the performance, scalability, stability, and security of the product as a whole
  • Manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
  • Participate actively in recruitment and nurturing of engineers as awesome as you.
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.

 

We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!

  • Mastery of visual design principles as they apply to the creation of large-scale web user interfaces, and practical knowledge of user centered design methodologies
  • Working knowledge of information architecture, navigation models and interaction design principles
  • Must be a clear and effective presenter in order to influence important design decisions and maintain credibility
  • Organized, have excellent time management skills and be highly detail oriented. Must be able to manage their own time in an efficient manner while receiving strategic and tactical direction from project stakeholders
  • Excellent interpersonal communication, management, negotiation, presentation  and client relations skills  
  • At least 5+ years of solid industry experience

Note: Willingness to travel and anchor client UX engagements for extensive duration (6 months to 1 yr+) is a must.

title: Global Creative Director
primaryresponsibility:
We’re looking for a passionate and experienced Creative Director to join our Creative marketing team! This role has a global scope and you will be expected to have exposure of creative and marketing campaigns across Europe, US and China as well. While the rest of the team sits out of Udupi, we are flexible to have the Creative Director working out of our Bangalore, Pune and Mumbai offices and regularly coordinate with Udupi team remotely as well as frequent visits.

  • Establish and manage the visual direction, visual systems, brand identity, production quality and style guide for our mobile games
  • Develop key marketing positioning and franchise management
  • Provide creative direction to our marketing team while retaining original IP's core brand values and game experience at all times
  • Build a learning environment within the marketing art team and implement processes of artistic research
  • Ensure quality through creative asset review, directing and oversight of the marketing process
  • Develop internal concepts and ideas for new marketing collaterals of IP and franchises
  • Problem-solve and identify new techniques, workflows, and technologies to drive quality and improve development; continue to make progress despite technical, game design, and production constraints and challenges
  • Objectively evaluate games from a commercial and critical focus. Ensure all teams operate and are informed by both quantitative and qualitative analytics, including any risks or concerns
  • Provide further support to 99Games’ business including presentation assets, brand building and presence and corporate requirements
  • Analyze real-time feedback, analytics in a constructive manner with logical and reasoned suggestions/solutions to improve on designs
  • Review and evolve brainstorming sessions based on innovative and optimal art practices
  • Work closely with game designers, developers and artists and testers and oversee the game as a whole
primaryrequirement:
• 12+ years of experience in an advertising / marketing art team with 3+ years in mobile app launches
  • Advocate of good design practices across the studio
  • Deep awareness of the competitive market place and target audience
  • Current on industry trends including new game genres, game art best practices, and emerging technology
  • Excited to explore gaming industry in depth across multiple global geographies
  • Fast turn-around times and can adapt to working in a fast paced environment

primaryresponsibility:

  • Create and optimize user flows towards a faster and intuitive user experience
  • Create innovative data visualizations to show insights from the data
  • Design web based user interfaces for internal admin applications
  • Design mobile apps in the future

You should be creative within constraints. We have a precise target audience which likes to see a lot of data on screen. This requires the candidate to think differently from common UX design principles while maintaining pleasing aesthetics and readability.

  • Graduate in Design or Engineering
  • Should be hands on with prototyping and implementation
  • Must have an eagle eye for pixels and alignment
  • Should have prior experience in designing data analytics platforms or dashboards
  • Experience with creating data visualizations
  • Ability to work and communicate seamlessly with UI developers

title: Senior User Experience Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Looking for SMART, SELF DRIVEN, CONFIDENT design comrades who have it in them to anchor large design engagements

  • Plan and execute UXD projects working independently with the client (multiple stakeholders) by diagnosing business and user needs
  • Create and present compelling design concepts as part of UX strategy
  • Provide insightful UI solutions to business challenges and design robust UI structures based on business and user insights
  • Partner with user researchers to drive research to find user needs
  • Work as a design lead to manage all interaction design activities including visual design co-ordination with global designers
  • Present design decisions to the stakeholders that are backed up by strong usability principles and rationale
  • Team up with the backend development people to ensure your design gets translated well as a final product .
  • Manage communication at all levels and be responsible for project deliverables with quality and on time
  • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple assignments simultaneously, while focusing on delivery quality
primaryrequirement:

  • Design Education in Interaction, UX Design or related fields is a must
  • Deeper eagerness for observing human behavior and synthesizing insights into design.
  • Hands-on experience of all usability processes
  • Proven ability to plan and conduct UX Design activities independently
  • Eye for details with strong knowledge of visual design principles
  • Experience designing types of UI (Website, GUI, Web, tablet, and Mobile applications)
  • Familiarity with various UI technologies
  • Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative study methods is preferred
  • Must possess excellent interpersonal communication, management, negotiation, presentation and client relations skills

primaryresponsibility:

You will be managing the complete experience of our platforms across Web and Mobile. You will be expected to deeply be connected to our stakeholders and users and suggest improvements across the board that will enhance the UX.

  • Take the ownership and define the end to end experience of products
  • Work with cross functional teams to plan, prioritize and deliver a cohesive user experience through innovative and interactive design support
  • Leverage modern web/app technologies to define innovative user interfaces and interaction models that result in delightful user experiences
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to communicate design strategy and rationale
  • Collaborate with fellow UXD team members to develop UI components and design patterns for next generation software applications
  • Produce aspirational mock ups, functional wireframes, screen layouts, color palettes, typography, user interface elements (iconography, gestures, behaviors, transitions, animations) and final assets
  • Demonstrate user centred design (UCD) techniques

  • Provide input and occasionally help conduct usability testing

  • 4+ years of work experience with a focus on interaction design and UX across a variety of platforms
  • Ability to clearly communicate concepts and designs through sketches and wireframes
  • Highly skilled in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Keynote and other design tools
  • Experience in designing from start to finish including the development process
  • Able to function independently and in a team environment with excellent collaboration skills
  • Deep understanding of user centered design processes and methodologies
  • Strong communications skills, oral and written able to engender trust and respect of peers and stakeholders

  • Develop prototypes based on your wireframes
  • Produce and present high quality reports, presentations, and recommendations based on your work

  • Maintain and build a culture of early feedback and sharing
  • Perform competitive benchmarking

  • Strong Axure, Sketch (or similar wire-framing tool) and MS Office skills

title: Senior Manager – User Experience & Design
primaryresponsibility:
EFI is looking for a Senior Manager, User Experience & Design to join and lead our Productivity Software Experience & Design team in our Bangalore office.  

EPS Productivity Suites provides out-of-the-box workflows with MIS at the core for Print and Packaging customers. We are committed to improve the value to our customers by providing best-in-class user experience in all our suite offerings. You will be leading the EPS global UX team (IDC, Europe & US) which will be helping us in redefining our productivity suite UX journey.

The User Experience Senior Manager is responsible for managing a team of user experience leads and designers responsible for knowledge gathering, solution exploration and conceptualization, and interaction / information design in an effort to optimize ROI and deliver a superior customer experience.

  • Working with EPS Product Management, Serve as a leading voice of the customer and act as a customer experience advocate in considering key decisions that will impact the customer
  • Ensure that conceptual designs and wireframes meet high standards and business goals for quality before development begins
  • Guide user experience leads and architects to ensure research and designs are well understood by product managers and stakeholders
  • Support and guide team members as they ideate, collaborate, and design new experiences for EFI Eco system
  • Play a key role in transforming for workflow experiences and evolving the upcoming design language
  • Coach User Experience Leads and designers as they respond to project escalations with an assessment of the business implications of changes to project scope, timeline, or resources
  • Develop, lead and inspire the User Experience team members, each responsible for defining and delivering user experience design with collocated and remote teams.
  • Create and foster career development and growth paths for team members in alignment with company, product and personal objectives
  • Create clear and measurable goals and objectives for the team related to the creation of designs, high-quality that support critical business objectives, and partnership with cross-functional teams
  • Raise awareness of team’s plans, insights and accomplishments in order to facilitate cooperation across departments and to build a highly performing, highly motivated team
  • Assist direct reports with ongoing prioritization and resource allocation to ensure that the crucial business initiatives are delivered
  • Lead teams in partnering with key business stakeholders and strategy team members to develop clear and insights and designs, and present to senior management the information necessary to make informed approval, prioritization and trade-off decisions
  • Ensure that all relevant parties and key stakeholders are informed of user experience design concept through launch
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key business owners, product owners, product management, creative and senior management
  • Ability to get hands on with research, design and delivery
  • Exceptionally strong conceptualization capabilities, excellent problem-solving skills, and ability to work well in a collaborative team environment
  • Ensure the experience vision is guided by business and market requirements and driven by experience insights
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and empathize with the user, to simplify the process, and to interpret that into a systematic user-centered UX solution
  • An exceptional understanding of fundamental design disciplines (typography, composition, color and animation) and principals (affordance, clustering, progressive disclosure, consistency, etc...)
  • Drive and represent design direction to team members, senior management, and key stakeholders
  • Direct and develop UX artifacts including personas streamlined scenarios, storyboards, information architecture, wireframes, visuals and interactive prototypes
  • Understand the array of technical constraints, user goals, and business requirements that shape customer-focused service products
primaryrequirement:
• 10+ years of experience in UX and/or related field
  • 5+ years of leading a team of highly motivated design team
  • Master’s degree in HCI, Design, or related experience
  • Experience designing for a broad set of form factors and environments including web, desktop and mobile
  • Experience in working and establishing UX best practices for complex enterprise applications
  • Experience in an agile framework like scrum is preferred
  • An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating relevant experience
  • Strong analytical, prioritization and negotiating skills

title: Senior Product Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We need designers who can shape the Chargebee Experience.

With a voice in every conversation and a stake in every project, the design team labors with visuals, employing empathy and curiosity, to bring our collective personality to the way the world experiences Chargebee and its vision.Chargebee’s product designers work on features with the engineering team, owning how a feature is experienced, making sure it’s built for people.

Lasting change over a temporary fix - Understand why the problem exists and what it would take to address it before a solution is even attempted

Design for a real need over a perceived need - Champion the perspective that we’re building for, incorporating it into design from our very first draft of a feature

Small tweaks equal big changes in experience - It’s small thoughts and tweaks (over and above the job the feature is built to perform) that make a feature easier to use and understand

On a Day-to-Day Basis, you will:

Ideate on future features

Product designers are involved in features right from the get go. They work closely with engineers and product managers to ensure that every feature is built with real people and real problems in mind

Talk to customers

Emphasising customer experience means a designer’s work on a feature is about half-way done after it is built. Getting all important customer feedback is the cornerstone of the iterative method

Collect data for your next experiment with design

The design team is constantly experimenting and iterating with ideas. Product designers work on gathering data on customer experience to inform decisions around how to tweak existing features

Demo a feature

Feature demos are (something we’re proud of at Chargebee) an opportunity for the designer and the developer working on a feature to present their work to and get feedback from every stakeholder involved - from the CEO to the marketing and sales teams.

You’ll be part of an experienced team, with a mentor who can guide you towards excellence. You’ll learn what it takes to design for online businesses, and most importantly, how to shape the experience of a complex feature that can be molded to suit any business model
primaryrequirement:
• An understanding of one or more of the following design tools: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Sketch
  • A command over basic design principles
  • Between two and ten years of experience in interface design, UX design or product design
  • If you obsess about the psychology that drives design - you can see it in everything from an everyday object to a piece of complicated machinery. Are you curious about how people experience ideas?
  • If you want room to experiment with the different aspects of design - from user interface to user experience and illustration. Chargebee affords the space to generalise or specialise as fits in with your career goals as a designer
  • If you’re hungry to give and receive feedback, fully understanding that challenging perspectives are the only way that you can grow
  • If you enjoy working with technical experts and creative content specialists
professions: UX Design$$$Information Architecture$$$Interaction Design$$$UI Design$$$Mobile Design$$$Web Design

title: Art Director
primaryresponsibility:
The Design Studio occupies a centripetal place at Chargebee. The team creates and collaborates cross-functionally to produce superlative design ideas for our market-facing efforts. The Art Director will help build and develop the design studio, while working dedicatedly, targeting our product vision.

Build our brand

Build our brand experience, our campaigns, our signature. You’ll put together the face of Chargebee and build a distinct brand persona

Think our brand

title: iOS Developer - Swift/Fullstack
primaryresponsibility:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Capable of implementing significant portions of code based upon well-defined requirements, adhering to established standards of quality for documentation and coding. Interacts well in a group, requiring some direction from manager and senior team members.  Able to identify and act upon issues and problems that arise.  

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Four year college degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

  • Strong Fundamentals in Data Structures and Algorithms

  • Conversant about Internet technologies, communication protocols, and techniques.

  • Conversant about database methodologies and database systems.  

  • Willingness to learn new platforms, as needed.

  • Produced at least one large-scale commercial product/system.

  • A solid understanding of any of following technologies with knowledge of debugging techniques and maintenance.

    • iOS (Swift), Xcode

    • eMQTT

    • Knowledge of Backend APIs, Databases

  • Experience in applying knowledge of good coding practices and fundamental computer science principles.

  • Ability to work in a team and take direction well.

  • Self-motivated and responds to supervision.  Asks relevant questions.

  • Can independently plan tasks and estimate their completion.

  • Can adapt to changing conditions.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Writes correct and clean code with guidance; consistently follows stated best practices.

  • Participates in the technical design of features with guidance.

  • Rarely makes the same mistake twice, begins to focus on attaining expertise in one or more areas.

  • Learns quickly and makes steady progress without the need for constant significant feedback from more senior engineers.

  • Makes steady progress on tasks; knows when to ask for help in order to get themselves unblocked.

  • Able to own small-to-medium features from technical design through completion.

  • Capable of prioritizing tasks; avoid getting caught up in unimportant tasks.

  • Self-sufficient in at least one large area of the codebase, with a high-level understanding of other components.

  • Capable of providing on-call support for their area including systems that they are not familiar with.

  • Gives timely, helpful feedback to peers and managers.

  • Communicates assumptions and gets clarification on tasks upfront to minimize the need for rework.

  • Solicits feedback from others and is eager to find ways to improve.

  • Understands how their work fits into the larger product and identifies problems with requirements.

  • Practices writing test cases and documentations.

  • Takes ownership of end to end delivery.
primaryrequirement: We are looking for full stack iOS developers with minimum 1-year experience in Swift. Candidate should have a high sense of ownership and should be able to take the product development end to end. The scope of work is not restricted to iOS. He/she should be working on the backend and frontend side of the product. Prefers B.tech Candidates from Tier 1 institutes.

title: Senior UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Sr. UX Designer

At HERE, you will own and account for the user experience of our internal tools.

You will be design lead in small and dedicated UX design team to develop, evolve and extend the experience on an ongoing basis for usable, useful and beautiful tools to use.

 

You will work in close collaboration with product owners, researchers and domain experts to define KPIs, customer journeys and features & functionality.

 

On the team you will operate with visual designers, editors, front-end engineers and product owners to conceptualize, create and maintain innovative, easy-to-use and delightful UI solutions, cross-channel integration and supporting release materials.

And you will work closely with back-end engineers and QA to ensure seamless and continuous development and deployment.

Last not least, you will represent the product experience and design to HERE stakeholders and external partners – and you’ll be an advocate for design vision and quality in the internal tools team, the overall HERE brand and beyond.



What we are looking for is soup-to-nuts and full-stack UX ownership!

Be passionate about your work and be able to communicate complex topics in a simple way, whether on paper, face to face or when designing UI.

Be able to effectively manage tasks of varying complexities, meet deadlines and work well under pressure.

Demonstrate you are proactive in sharing your expertise and be happy to engage with others, to inspire and to mentor.
primaryrequirement:
You are a UX and UI designer at heart and by conviction. You believe that less is more, but you know tha the detail makes the product. You understand the business needs for design as well as the complexities of deployment. As such, you are striving to conceive, create and implement first-in-class User Experience in products and services..  

  • Exceptional portfolio, with focus on user experience for several types of media and platforms such as web, mobile OSs, desktop applications and speech/chatbot interfaces.
  • Strong technical knowledge of how web-based technologies apply to design.
  • Expert knowledge of usability principles and techniques. Fluency in best practices for visual design.
  • Proficiency in all standard design and prototyping tools. Front-end programming knowledge is welcome.
  • You should be able to handle complexity. Experience in working with research experts, techniques and formats is expected. Experience with data analytics and business intelligence is a plus.
  • Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with internal and external stakeholders, customers and developers.
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
  • Experience in Agile development environments.
  • Degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience
  • At least 6 years of experience as a UX designer, creative director, or similar role.

  • Attending meetings and briefings with the Business Development teams and Marketing Managers to understand business requirements
  • Converting these briefs into effective design solutions that marry marketing and merchandising strategies from conceptualisation to completion
  • Supervising intermediate and junior graphic designers in creating concepts, layouts, banners and final art within the stipulated time
  • Working with the Creative Head to constantly innovate and up the standards of Hopscotch’s visual language and branding guidelines
  • Monitoring and measuring visits to the boutiques and special pages to increase click-through rates
  • Maintaining high standards and ensuring only the best work is released to the client
  • Staying up-to-date with industry trends
primaryrequirement:
• Under-graduate or Master Degree in Design/Communication
  • 3+ years of work experience in established advertising agencies or branding design houses
  • A never-ending desire to grow and learn
  • Complete understanding of graphic design, typography and digital standards
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • In-depth design capabilities
  • Confidence to delegate tasks
  • The ability to keep a cool head and meet deadlines
  • Problem solving skills

  • The foresight to put themselves in the shoes of the user
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Significant graphic design experience
  • A high bar of quality across the board - from your own contributions to the people you work with to the creative concepts that get delivered
  • A “driver” personality - action-oriented, great collaborator and master simplifier - constantly pushing towards clarity and delivery

title: UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Job Description
We are looking for a user-experience designer responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes. You will also design the overall functionality of the product and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience.


Responsibilities


-Translate concepts into wireframes and mock-ups that lead to intuitive user experiences.


-Facilitate client's product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for digital products.


-Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mock-ups optimised for a wide range of devices and interfaces.


-Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.


-Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.


-Take a user-centred design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.


-Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.


-Take smart risks and champion new ideas.
primaryrequirement:
-One or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments.


-Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.


-Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.


-A solid grasp of user-centred design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.


-Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.


-Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.


-A clear understanding of the importance of user-centred design.


-Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.


-Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.


-Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.


-Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.


Skills: Wireframe, Prototyping, Visual Design

title: Senior art director/designer
primaryresponsibility:
At merry men, we are building an agency that prides itself on the work it does.

Your primary role would be to come up with amazing ideas and then beautifully craft and design the campaigns we work on, for the online and offline medium. 

You will also have to lead a team of two more young designers and ensure that they have sufficient direction to create good work. We would also look towards you to be part of client briefings, presentations and contribute towards pitches.
primaryperks:
The biggest perks of working for Merry Men is not being stuck in a cubicle. We work out of an old heritage bungalow in Bandra. 2 Mins walking distance from the sea. Lush greenery outside our window. And dogs around our feet. 

Our work culture is strongly rooted in being nice to each other and having each other's back. There are no rigid lines that define our various job functions and anyone is welcome to contribute ideas across the board. There is also no hierarchy. Everyone has a say in everything, from campaigns to the colour we should paint our walls. 

Miniatire pin pong, badminton in winters, beers every now and then, and scrabble are some of the other things that you will get to enjoy.
primaryrequirement:
We are looking for a merry man or woman, who is passionate about what they do, is driven and most importantly, persistent. We take quality very seriously, so you need to be just as anal about it.

A multidimensional person who is comfortable with different mediums and media. You realise that the world is about Pixels. You enjoy designing and understand the online medium thoroughly. Good sound knowledge of digital. Have an outstanding portfolio and a sound grounding in design and communication. Have complete grasp of various design related software ( if you know after effects or any video related software, that's extra brownie points). 

Lastly, you need to be a team player. For us our culture is very important. Which means you should be someone who adds to it and not takes away from it.

primaryresponsibility:

The ideal candidate will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.

  • Designing the user experience for both new and existing web applications and products

Impart day-to-day strategic design leadership that fosters a shared understanding of the intersection  between user needs, technology requirements, and business goals

  • 2+ years of user experience design experience for web & mobile applications

title: UX designer
primaryresponsibility:
Middle-weight UX / Product Designer (5-7 years)

We’re looking for a talented designer who will own the end-to-end product design process. From whiteboarding to mocks, shipping, and iterating -- you’ll do it all. The role will require a combination of your creative and your rational side. 

Your responsibilities:

  • Own the design direction and strategy for specific workflow and product 
  • Work closely with product management, engineering and stakeholders to create designs 
  • Translate vague, high-level concepts into clean, intuitive and functional experiences 
  • Create wireframes, user flows, and prototypes to validate design concepts with stakeholders through user testing

title: Product Designer
primaryresponsibility:
As a Product Designer of a multidisciplinary design team of Hopscotch you will craft delightful end- to-end digital experiences for customers. You’ll jump from high level product thinking, to design interaction flows and knock out “just enough fidelity” mockups.

You’ll work alongside Product & Engineering to develop and ship a meaningful, cohesive experience for our customers. You will get the opportunity to design solutions for our internal products and processes too. If you’re a generalist who loves to play an active role in each stage of the product process, this is the job for you.

  • Take on early-stage product concepts and transform them into intuitive, accessible and engaging customer experiences across platforms (Web, iOS and Android)
  • Develop detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas with stakeholders
  • Transform wireframes to meticulously designed user-interfaces such that the information is easy to read, easy to understand and easy to find
  • Collaborate closely with teams of Designers, Product Managers throughout the design process— from crafting user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups

  • Experience creating personas, information architecture, flow diagrams, wireframes and prototypes
  • Demonstrated experience in crafting consumer facing digital interfaces
  • Mobile design experience preferred (Mobile Web, Android and iOS Apps)

Our designers along with other great teams are at work creating the best billing experience in the world, while also acknowledging and recognizing the scope of the ramifications of design - ethical and moral. We are looking for a competent Product Designer - a design expert who’ll bring in design expertise and the strategic mindset that’ll propel ours to a next level product experience.
primaryrequirement:

title: UI/UX Designer
primaryresponsibility:
Soroco seeks a UI / UX designer to create stunning interfaces for our various automation products and features. The ideal candidate should have an impeccable eye for clean, elegant design and strong instincts on user behavior. The designer’s responsibilities include, but aren’t limited to, the following:

  • Upgrading all existing UIs, including dashboard, chat tools, and websites
  • Identifying new design problems and devising elegant solutions that are in line with branding guidelines
  • Translating product concepts into wireframes and mock-ups that lead to intuitive user experiences

primaryresponsibility:
Lorem Ipsum - All the facts - Lipsum generator

Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source. Lorem Ipsum comes from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum" (The Extremes of Good and Evil) by Cicero, written in 45 BC. This book is a treatise on the theory of ethics, very popular during the Renaissance. The first line of Lorem Ipsum, "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet..", comes from a line in section 1.10.32.
primaryperks:
Lorem Ipsum - All the facts - Lipsum generator

There are many variations of passages of Lorem Ipsum available, but the majority have suffered alteration in some form, by injected humour, or randomised words which don't look even slightly believable. If you are going to use a passage of Lorem Ipsum, you need to be sure there isn't anything embarrassing hidden in the middle of text. All the Lorem Ipsum generators on the Internet tend to repeat predefined chunks as necessary, making this the first true generator on the Internet. It uses a dictionary of over 200 Latin words, combined with a handful of model sentence structures, to generate Lorem Ipsum which looks reasonable. The generated Lorem Ipsum is therefore always free from repetition, injected humour, or non-characteristic words etc.

title: Head of Design
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for Head of Design who will work with our world class dev teams to revolutionize the world of real time communications. The products comprise of mobile, desktop and web interfaces. You will be a leading of a team of passionate product designers, Interaction designers, software developers etc. and participate in the entire development lifecycle, including strategy, vision, design, development.

As the Design Head, you will work with motivated individuals who are passionate-beyond-measure about usability, to deliver a kick-ass user experience for our revolutionary suite of products and services. You will be responsible for the entire UX lifecycle of all on-going projects, including:

  • Participate in all the phases of the product, from discovery to delivery to iteration. You'll work closely with Product Managers, Interaction Designers, Visual Designers and Front-end Engineers to build a robust design system and a world-class product.
  • You will be responsible for designing a holistic experience taking into consideration various user touchpoints, and understanding the user's journey over time as they interact with the product.
  • You will be involved in user testing to be able to constantly validate and refine ideas as well as collect new insights. You should be able to discard ideas, no matter how good they are, if they fail to drive value to our end users.
  • You should exhibit fluency in both Interaction and Visual Design, knowing when to dive into
    wireframes and when to plunge into pixel-perfection.
  • As a design head, inspire and collaborate with other designers to make their work better
  • Own the design process end-to-end – translating research into actionable insights, then designing workflows and design to build product features.
  • Deliver excellent experiences to our customers through both your own craft of design, strategy and execution, as well as by fostering a team of top-notch designers.
  • Direct and deliver design strategies, frameworks and deliverables on a broad range of projects, near-term and future.
  • Work closely with engineers as they build the design
  • Contribute to and participate in a collaborative, knowledge-sharing design community.
  • Oversee the evolution and implementation of our brand design guidelines for all marketing and communication channels

You will be expected to research and apply user-centered design processes to create high quality user experiences, and reusable mocks and wireframe templates for various products. You will also be involved in mentorship and training of peers as well as members of other teams on relevant topics.
primaryperks:
Directians love their jobs, and not just because we offer the most competitive salaries in the industry. Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. Our workspaces are comfortable and fun, complete with bean bag chairs, ping pong tables, and all the snacks you can eat. We have no dress code (tee-shirts are a-ok!). We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Directi has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency.

 

We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy Directians are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
primaryrequirement:
• 8+ years of experience in design positions in successful high-growth ecommerce/internet, online media or software product companies. 3+ years leading and managing teams
  • Demonstrated leader with ability to attract outstanding talent, create and sustain a culture of high performance
  • Strong technical ability; capable of conducting mission-critical design discussions with Product Managers and business leads
  • Skilled at implementing and optimizing organizational structure and creative development processes that allow the design team to scale with the company
  • Product-minded design leader with the confidence and ability to be a thought-partner to business leads and CEO
  • Track record of translating product vision into actionable plans that lead to the creation of high-quality user experience and engagement.
  • A very strong understanding of interaction and visual design concepts
  • The ability to clearly communicate and document your design decisions
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Understanding of the nuances of each platform, be it Desktop, Android or iOS
  • Mastery of design tools including Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, Principle etc.

title: Video Producer
primaryresponsibility:
Soroco seeks a mid tenure video producer to create excellent multimedia content for various audiences – clients, prospective hires, employees etc.

  • Create and develop multimedia (audio/video) content for customer stories, internal company announcement videos, external promotional social videos, product marketing videos, recruiting videos, corporate training and other enterprise-wide projects  
  • Script, storyboard, budget, allocate resources, set deadlines and select optimal forms of media for projects  
  • Work independently, as well as part of a team to establish project deliverables  
  • Manage team of junior animators and graphic designers

  • Plan video shoots; scout, select and reserve shoot locations  
  • Develop production schedules  
  • Record and edit video and sound projects, including selecting program format for final output, capturing/importing  media, organizing raw media, editing footage and sound files, creating and inserting static and motion graphics,  titling, adding music/voice-over/sfx, media management and archiving project media  
  • Manage video library  
  • Evaluate analytics

title: Senior UI Designer
primaryresponsibility:
We are looking for a talented UI Designer to create amazing user experiences. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

Product

  • Design outstanding visuals for Mobile, Web, Backend applications and collaborate closely with UX designers to translate wireframes into visual designs and give life to the user experience
  • Design clean interfaces that visually communicate the UX for a target audience who are multi-lingual speaking, first time users of mobile apps
  • Establish the design language, style guides, design libraries and design assets that can be used across multiple apps and use cases.
  • Have deep knowledge of Information Design, Iconography, Typography, Layout and Color theory
  • Experience in delivering design assets for development and ability to partner with front-end engineers to ensure design consistency
  • Excellent collaboration, written and verbal communication skills with an eye for detail
  • Excellent knowledge in design tools like Sketch, Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Experience in prototyping designs for mobile and collaborating with user researchers

Process

  • Aware of user-centric design processes from research to design and usability testing
  • Familiarity with Lean UX process. Ability to work with highly technical teams and handle multiple projects in a fast-paced early stage startup environment
  • Experience using user research to inform design decisions
  • Ability to use data to make design decisions, and Ability to work with product/tech teams to study product performance and iterate design backed by data driven hypothesis

title: Digital Designer
primaryresponsibility:
The Digital Designer produces the design function for the Marketing Team at Darwinbox. The position is responsible for delivering effective, aesthetic, on-brand, and on-strategy creatives for landing pages, banner ads, email templates and social media graphics.

 

What’s in for you?

You will be one of the members of the founding employee group playing a pivotal role building the coolest next-generation enterprise products. We promise you best-in industry compensation. More importantly, we will provide you challenging yet fun filled working environment, exposure to complete product development lifecycle, real-time business challenges and how you are going to address them through digital products. You will also have a chance to work with and be mentored by the founders directly. We recognise the importance of a strong brand identity in order to further grow, which is why we are looking for you!

 

Digital Designer 2-6 Years:

The Digital Designer produces the design function for the Marketing Team at Darwinbox. The position is responsible for delivering effective, aesthetic, on-brand, and on-strategy creatives for landing pages, banner ads, email templates and social media graphics.

Your Responsibilities:
● Produce the design and production of digital marketing banners, email campaigns 
● Translate product positioning, existing research, and offline/online Marketing strategies into effective designs 
● Work with Marketing to translate and create requirements into compelling, appropriate campaigns 
● Ensure consistency of brand 
● Challenge and contribute ideas to further develop our brand and status quo of current marketing activities

Have we sparked your interest? Then send us your Portfolio!
primaryperks:
As fitment with the organization culture is very important, you will immensely like the job if you 

  • enjoy working in a fast-paced company environment
  • like to see business impact of whatever they do for the customer
  • prefer a non-hierarchical, independent and non-pushy environment
  • are self-motivated to take up a high degree of ownership
primaryrequirement:
What should you have? 
● Bachelor’s degree in digital design, graphic design, graphic communications or 2-6 years of related professional work experience with a solid portfolio 
● Proficient in designing marketing campaigns including Digital banners, email templates and social media Graphics etc 
● Proficient in creating motion graphics (Adobe After Effects, Principle, etc.) will be an added advantage 
● Knowledge of digital marketing is a plus 
● Strong work ethic and personal accountability 
● Strong attention to detail and good interpersonal skills
